data.text: @BurnyFlanders @MooneyGerard What "triggered" my thoughts was how many use the "lockdown" term with careless abandon. At least we're in agreement that it should b used where everything else fails. Simpler mitigations (note i dont say restrictions) can b used with little impact on way of life. Vax alone !work
@GininaTeacup1 @MooneyGerard Negative today after 11 days…defo on the mend but still totally exhausted after any task!
@valw13 @MooneyGerard Hope you make a fast and full recovery Valerie

@fart_general @MooneyGerard Well Fart General, I can see that lockdown triggered your thoughts on the topic. I meant it as a catch all phrase for the restrictions. I don’t believe it’s a suitable long term plan. You’re only kicking the can down the road. Vaccines are outdated by the time they come to market

@BurnyFlanders Glad you faired well and are better now thank god. As stated in the other comment, the word “lockdown” is always used now when someone stated issues with the handling of Covid. Nobody wants a lockdown but some measures to stop the spread so many now on second some 3rd infection

@BurnyFlanders @MooneyGerard Glad u got over it, many left with long covid. Where did this thread ask for a lockdown? Why do some always jump to 'lockdown' when someone mentions mitigating risks? As for immunity, tell that to the kids who were ill with it before Xmas and are on their 2nd go of it again now.

@MooneyGerard We can’t stay locked in doors forever. I’ve had covid recently and similar to 99.8% I survived with some cold/flu like symptoms. While I get that some people are at greater risk we should not lock down everyone, especially now that there’s so much immunity.
@martenIRL I’m assuming you mean “Covid is here for many years” meaning it’s not going anywhere??
